question: Match the following:
column_I: Members having cell walls excluded from Plantae
column_II: Algae, Bryophytes, Pteridophytes, Gymnosperms and Angiosperms
matches: Members having cell walls excluded from Plantae – Monera, Protista and Fungi
Popular name of Kingdom Plantae – Plant kingdom
Groups described under Plantae – Algae, Bryophytes, Pteridophytes, Gymnosperms and Angiosperms
answer: Five Kingdom classification – Whittaker (1969), Members having cell walls excluded from Plantae – Monera, Protista and Fungi, Popular name of Kingdom Plantae – Plant kingdom, Blue green algae – Cyanobacteria, Groups described under Plantae – Algae, Bryophytes, Pteridophytes, Gymnosperms and Angiosperms

question: Match the following:
column_I: Classification given by George Bentham and Joseph Dalton Hooker
column_II: Used only gross superficial morphological characters
Based mainly on vegetative characters or on the androecium structure
Gave equal weightage to vegetative and sexual characteristics
Based on natural affinities among the organisms
matches: Earliest systems of classification – Used only gross superficial morphological characters
System given by Linnaeus – Based mainly on vegetative characters or on the androecium structure
Basis of artificial systems – Gave equal weightage to vegetative and sexual characteristics
Natural classification systems – Based on natural affinities among the organisms
Classification given by George Bentham and Joseph Dalton Hooker – Classification for flowering plants
answer: Earliest systems of classification – Used only gross superficial morphological characters, System given by Linnaeus – Based mainly on vegetative characters or on the androecium structure, Basis of artificial systems – Gave equal weightage to vegetative and sexual characteristics, Natural classification systems – Based on natural affinities among the organisms, Classification given by George Bentham and Joseph Dalton Hooker – Classification for flowering plants

question: Match the following:
matches: Vegetative characters – More easily affected by environment
Sexual characteristics – Considered in natural classification systems
External features – Not only external features
Phytochemistry – Also part of internal features
answer: Vegetative characters – More easily affected by environment, Sexual characteristics – Considered in natural classification systems, External features – Not only external features, Internal features – Ultra-structure, anatomy, embryology, Phytochemistry – Also part of internal features
